meanings.definition: A unit of currency in the fictional world of Kadesh.
meanings.sent1: In Kadesh, you can buy a lot with just a few kades.
meanings.sent2: She saved up her kades to purchase a special item.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted kades, no other currency.
meanings.sent4: His wealth was measured not in gold, but in kades.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kades jingled in his pocket as he walked.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the name Kade.
meanings.sent1: The classroom had many students named Kade and Kades.
meanings.sent2: Kade and his brothers were known as the Kades in town.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, all the Kades gathered together.
meanings.sent4: The team was made up of three Kades and a few others.
meanings.sent5: The Kades were a close-knit group, always supporting each other.

meanings.definition: The act of making a decision or judgment.
meanings.sent1: Her quick kades led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent2: The kades of the jury determined the defendant's fate.
meanings.sent3: Making kades under pressure can be challenging.
meanings.sent4: His kades were always fair and well-thought-out.
meanings.sent5: The kades she made that day changed her life forever.
